original: Elg, Gösta, major, Karlskrona, f. 20/6/93 å Dalarö, Sthlms 1., av tullför-valt. Axel Fredrik E. o. Anna Jönsson. G. 1. 18-45 m. Maud John-sitone; 2. 47 m-. Birgit DiainielisisOin. Barn: Lennart f. 22, d. 43, Gunnar 28. — Studiex. i Norrköp. 12, off:ex. 14, signaloff :kup 20, ridkurs 23, TOK 29-30. Und:löjtn. v. Karlskrona gren:-reg. 14, ilöjtn. 16, v. Kronob. reg. 28, kapt. 29, miajor 41, i res. 46. Sekr. o. chefsinstrukt. f. Ö. Biliek. ilandst :fören. 25-40, ordf. i Karlskrona bef:utb:-förb. sed. 45, v. ordf. i Blek. bef:utb:-förb. sed. 46, led. av styr. f. Off. mål-skjutn:förb. i Karlskrona sed. 25, sekr. i Blek. :skytteförb. 33-35. RSO, Land-st :SM, SkytteGM, Blek. kndst :förb. GM, Bdiek. skyitteförb. GM, SvmiifbSM m. fl.
translated: Elg, Gösta, Major, Karlskrona, born June 20th, 1893 in Dalarö, Stockholm 1st district, son of the customs inspector Axel Fredrik E. and Anna Jönsson. Married 1st in 1945 to Maud Johnstone for 18 years; 2nd marriage in 1947 to Birgit DiainielisisOin for 47 years. Children: Lennart, born in 1922 and died in 1943, Gunnar, born in 1928. Gösta studied in Norrköping and completed his officer's exam in 1914, his signal officer course in 1920, his riding course in 1923 and the Military Academy's higher tactical course in 1929-1930. He became Second Lieutenant in the Karlskrona Grenadiers’ Regiment in 1914, Lieutenant in 1916, Lieutenant of the Kronoberg Regiment in 1928, Captain in 1929, Major in 1941 and in reserve from 1946. He was secretary and chief instructor for the Östra Blekinge County Association from 1925-1940. He was chairman of the Karlskrona Armed Forces’ Association since 1945 and deputy chairman of the Blekinge Armed Forces’ Association since 1946. He was a member of the board for the Military Shooting Association in Karlskrona since 1925, and secretary of the Blekinge Shooting Association from 1933-1935. He was awarded RSO, Landsting’s silver medal, SkytteGM, Blekinge Art Association's gold medal, Blekinge Shooting Association's gold medal, and SvmiifbSM, among others.
